pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:0.5: 32. The training rule on eating in a group
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Rājagaha in the Bamboo Grove, the squirrel sanctuary.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.2: At that time, because of his loss of material support and honor, Devadatta and his followers had to ask families repeatedly to get invited to meals.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.4: “How can the Sakyan monastics repeatedly ask families to get invited to meals?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.5: Who doesn’t like nice food? Who doesn’t prefer tasty food?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.6: The monks heard the complaints of those people,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.7: and the monks of few desires complained and criticized those monks,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.8: “How can Devadatta and his followers repeatedly ask families to get invited to meals?” …
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.9: “Is it true, Devadatta, that you do this?”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.12: “Foolish man, how can you do this?
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.14: “And, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.15.1: ‘If a monk eats in a group, he commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:1.16: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.1: Soon afterwards people invited sick monks to a meal.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.2: But knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating in a group and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not accept.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.4: Soon afterwards he gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.5: “Monks, I allow a sick monk to eat in a group.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.6: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.7.1: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.8: This is the appropriate occasion: he is sick.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:2.9: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.1: Soon afterwards, during the robe-giving season, people prepared a meal together with robe-cloth and then invited the monks, saying,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.2: “We wish to offer a meal and then give robe-cloth.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.3: But knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating in a group and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not accept.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.4: As a result, they only got a small amount of robe-cloth.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.6: “Monks, I allow you to eat in a group during the robe-giving season.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.7: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.8.1: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.9: These are the appropriate occasions: he is sick; it is the robe-giving season.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:3.10: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.1: Soon afterwards people invited the robe-making monks for a meal.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.2: But knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating in a group and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not accept.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.4: “Monks, I allow you to eat in a group at a time when you are making robes.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.5: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.6.1: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.7: These are the appropriate occasions: he is sick; it is the robe-giving season; it is a time of making robes.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:4.8: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.1: Soon afterwards some monks went traveling with a group of people.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.2: The monks said to those people,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.3: “Please wait a moment while we walk for alms.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.6: But knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating in a group and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not accept.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.8: “Monks, I allow you to eat in a group when you’re traveling.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.9: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.10.1: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.11: These are the appropriate occasions: he is sick; it is the robe-giving season; it is a time of making robes; he is traveling.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:5.12: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.1: Soon afterwards some monks were traveling by boat with a group of people.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.2: The monks said to those people, “Please go to the shore for a moment while we walk for alms.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.3: They replied, “Venerables, please eat right here.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.4: But knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating in a group and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not accept.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.6: “Monks, I allow you to eat in a group when on board a boat.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.7: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.8.1: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.9: These are the appropriate occasions: he is sick; it is the robe-giving season; it is a time of making robes; he is traveling; he is on a boat.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:6.10: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.1: Soon afterwards monks who had completed the rainy-season residence in various regions were coming to Rājagaha to visit the Buddha.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.2: People saw those monks who had come from various countries and invited them for a meal.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.3: But knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating in a group and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not accept.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.5: “Monks, I allow you to eat in a group on big occasions.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.6: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.7.1: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.8: These are the appropriate occasions: he is sick; it is the robe-giving season; it is a time of making robes; he is traveling; he is on a boat; it is a big occasion.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:7.9: In this way the Buddha laid down this training rule for the monks.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.1: Soon afterwards a relative of King Seniya Bimbisāra of Magadha who had gone forth with the Ājīvaka ascetics went to the King and said, “Great king, I wish to make a meal for the monastics of all religions.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.2: “That’s fine, Sir, if you first feed the Sangha of monks headed by the Buddha.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.4: And he sent a message to the monks: “Please accept a meal from me tomorrow.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.5: But knowing that the Buddha had prohibited eating in a group and being afraid of wrongdoing, they did not accept.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.6: That Ājīvaka ascetic then went to the Buddha, exchanged pleasantries with him, and said,
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.7: “Good Gotama has gone forth and so have I.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.8: One who has gone forth should receive alms from another who has gone forth.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.9: Good Gotama, please accept a meal from me tomorrow together with the Sangha of monks.”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.10: The Buddha consented by remaining silent.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.11: The Ājīvaka understood that the Buddha had consented, and he left.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.12: Soon afterwards the Buddha gave a teaching and addressed the monks:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.13: “Monks, I allow you to eat in a group when the meal is given by a monastic.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.14: And so, monks, this training rule should be recited like this:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.15.1: ‘If a monk eats in a group, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:8.16: These are the appropriate occasions: he is sick; it is the robe-giving season; it is a time of making robes; he is traveling; he is on a boat; it is a big occasion; it is a meal given by a monastic.’”
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.2: wherever four monks, after being invited, eat any of the five cooked foods—this is called “eats in a group”.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.4: unless it is an appropriate occasion.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.6: even if he has cracked feet, he may eat in a group.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.8: if he has not participated in the robe-making ceremony, he may eat in a group during the last month of the rainy season. If he has participated in the robe-making ceremony, he may eat in a group during the five month period.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.9: It is a time of making robes:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.10: when he is making robes, he may eat in a group.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.12: he may eat in a group if he intends to travel at least six kilometers, while traveling, and after traveling.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.14: he may eat in a group if he intends to board a boat, while on board, and after disembarking.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.16: if two or three monks can get by on walking for alms, but not a group of four, he may eat in a group.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.17: It is a meal given by a monastic:
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.18: if any kind of wanderer is making the meal, he may eat in a group.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.19: If he receives something intending to eat it, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.1.20: For every mouthful, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.1: If he eats in a group, and he perceives it as such, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.2: If he eats in a group, but he is unsure of it, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.3: If he eats in a group, but he does not perceive it as such, except on an appropriate occasion, he commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.4: If he does not eat in a group, but he perceives it as such, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.5: If he does not eat in a group, but he is unsure of it, he commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.2.6: If he does not eat in a group, and he does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.2: if it is an appropriate occasion;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.3: if two or three eat together;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.4: if they eat together after walking for alms;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.5: if it is a regular meal invitation;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.6: if it is a meal for which lots are drawn;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.7: if it is a half-monthly meal;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.8: if it is on the observance day;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.9: if it is on the day after the observance day;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.10: if it is anything apart from the five cooked foods;
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.12: if he is the first offender.
pli-tv-bu-vb-pc32:9.3.13: The training rule on eating in a group, the second, is finished.
